Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery stemmed plate with root of stem; white slip; interior, from outside: hook maeander frieze between dilute lines; to the centre, decoration consisting of unclear motif, possibly part of an animal's back, with added red over black and row of single vertical dots; rosette and group of small vertical tongues as filling ornament; underside reserved (if worn).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2150) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
